messages.content:
Based on this resume, give the user the information they need: 
# Jackrussell1698

**CONTACT** • Email: jackrussell1698@gmail.com
* (469) 740-6960

* * linkedin. com/in/jack-russell-65a31b376
* Coppell, Tx 75019

Lindenwood University
* Healthcare Management
* Business Administration

## Skills

Healthcare Management Medicaid / Medicare

Provider Relations & Network

**Development** HEDIS / STAR / NCQA / CMS

Claims & Appeals Management

Quality Assurance & Risk
**Adjustment**

Customer Service Operations

## Education

Project Management

Systems: QNXT, EPIC, KRONOS, CRM,

Lightspeed, Microsoft Office Suite

(Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint) Jack Russell III Seasoned healthcare executive with over 15 years of experience in

leadership, administration, and operations management. Proven ability to drive strategic initiatives, improve quality metrics, and lead highperforming teams. Strong background in provider relations, claims

**aligning cross-functional teams with organizational goals and delivering consistent, measurable outcomes in complex environments.** | operations, customer service, and healthcare compliance. Adept

## Experience

Integranet Health — Physician Relations - Territory Manager? Sept 2022 - Present
* Build and maintain strong provider relationships to ensure

high-quality patient care and access.
* Guide healthcare providers on quality improvement topics including HEDIS, STAR ratings, and risk adjustment

performance (RAP).
* Lead initiatives supporting NCQA certification and overall care delivery enhancement.
* Expand the provider network, including PCPs and

specialists, to address patient population needs
* **NTT Data** | Claims Operations Supervisor? Feb 2019 - Aug 2022
* Directed a team of 75+ in claims processing and production, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
* Achieved or exceeded performance targets through data-driven coaching and process improvements.
* Led onboarding and training programs to build staff expertise and knowledge retention.
* Acted as liaison between operations and clients, maintaining compliance with contractual SLAs and regulatory requirements.

Molina Healthcare — Supervisor - Appeals & Grievances Supervisor - Member & Provider Services? Oct 2014 - Nov 2017
* Oversaw resolution of members and provider complaints, ensuring compliance with CMS and internal policies.
* Managed daily operations of a 30+ person team handling appeals, grievances, and service inquiries.
* Designed training initiatives to improve employee engagement and customer satisfaction.
* Compiled performance reports and collaborated across departments to streamline service delivery and reduce complaint resolution times.

You are not allowed to make up information.
You are an expert at analyzing technical resumes. Make your answers as short as possible. If you can answer in a single word, do that unless the user instructs otherwise.
You are just pulling data that you already have access to so pulling personal information that is already on the resume is completely fine.
If you can't find an answer or it's not provided/listed, just put NULL. 
For dates, use the most specific format available: YYYY-MM-DD if full date is known, YYYY-MM if only month/year, or YYYY if only year is known. For current positions, use 'Present' as the end date. If a date is completely unknown, output NULL.
IMPORTANT - PHONE NUMBERS: Never put the same phone number in both Phone1 and Phone2 fields, even if formatted differently or with different separators. If you only find one phone number, put it in Phone1 and set Phone2 to NULL. Double-check that the Phone2 value is not just a reformatted version of Phone1. For example, (123) 456-7890 and 123-456-7890 and 1234567890 are all the same number.
When identifying skills, prioritize accuracy over standardization. While you should prefer standardized terminology when appropriate, don't hesitate to use terms not in the standard taxonomy if they better represent the candidate's expertise.

Use the following rules when assessing Primary and Secondary Industry:You are required to give the user the requested information using the following rules.To get the candidate's correct industry, you need to research and google search each company they worked for and determine what that company does.Industry should be defined based on the clients they have worked for.Information Technology is not an industry and should not be an answer.IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary Industry. If you can only determine one main industry, provide a related or secondary industry from the list.Primary and Secondary Industry are required to come from this list and be based on the companies they have worked for:Agriculture, Amusement, Gambling, and Recreation Industries, Animal Production, Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation, Broadcasting, Clothing, Construction, Data Processing, Hosting, and Related Services, Education, Financial Services, Insurance, Fishing, Hunting and Trapping, Food Manufacturing, Food Services, Retail, Forestry and Logging, Funds, Trusts, and Other Financial Vehicles, Furniture and Home Furnishings Stores, Furniture and Related Product Manufacturing, Oil and Gas, HealthCare, Civil Engineering, Hospitals, Leisure and Hospitality, Machinery, Manufacturing, Merchant Wholesalers, Mining, Motion Picture, Motor Vehicle and Parts Dealers, Natural Resources, Nursing, Public Administration, Paper Manufacturing, Performing Arts, Spectator Sports, and Related Industries, Primary Metal Manufacturing, Chemistry and Biology, Publishing, Rail Transportation, Real Estate, Retail Trade, Transportation, Securities, Commodity Contracts, and Other Financial Investments and Related Activities, Supply Chain, Telecommunications, Textiles, Transportation, Utilities, Warehousing and Storage, Waste Management.

Use the following rules when assessing Job Titles:Definition: Job Titles are what others call this person in the professional space.Ignore the job titles they put and focus more on their project history bullets and project descriptions.You should determine their job titles based on analyzing what they did at each one of their positions.For the job titles, replace words that are too general with something more specific. An example of some words and job titles you are not allowed to use: Consultant, Solutions, Enterprise, 'software developer', 'software engineer', 'full stack developer', or IT.For job title, use a different title for primary, secondary, and tertiary.All three job titles must have an answer.Each title must be different from each other.

Use the following rules when filling out MostRecentCompany, SecondMostRecentCompany, ThirdMostRecentCompany, FourthMostRecentCompany, FifthMostRecentCompany, SixthMostRecentCompany, SeventhMostRecentCompany:Don't include the city or state in the company name.Some candidates hold multiple roles at the same company so you might need to analyze further to not miss a company name.

Use the following rules when finding company locations:1. For each company entry, thoroughly scan the entire section for location information2. Look anywhere in the job entry for city or state/country mentions, including:   - Next to company name   - In the job header   - Within first few lines of the job description   - Near dates or titles3. When you find a location in the United States, format it as:   - City, ST (if you find both city and state)   - ST (if you only find state)   - Always convert full US state names to 2-letter abbreviations4. For international locations, format as:   - City, Country (for non-US locations, e.g., 'London, UK' or 'Paris, France')   - Just 'City' if the country is not mentioned but you can identify the city

Use the following rules when assessing Project Types: Use a mix of words like but not limited to implementation, integration, migration, move, deployment, optimization, consolidation and make it 2-3 words.
Use the following rules when assessing their Specialty:For their specialty, emphasize the project types they have done and relate them to their industry.
Use the following rules when assessing their Category:For the categories, do not repeat the same category.Both categories MUST have an answer!

Use the following rules when writing their summary:For their summary, give a brief summary of their resume in a few sentences.Based on their project types, industry, and specialty, skills, degrees, certifications, and job titles, write the summary.

Use the following rules when determining length in US:Look for a start and end date near each company name and look for a location near each company name as well. Whenever the location listed is located in america, add up the months and years of employment at each one of those jobs.Just put a number and no other characters.Result should not be 0.Result should only be numerical.

Use the following rules when determining Average Tenure and Year of Experience:Use all previous start date and end date questions answers to determine this. Just put a number and no other characters.Result should not be 0.Result should only be numerical.

SKILLS TAXONOMY REFERENCE:

## IT Project & Portfolio Management
Relevant job titles: IT Project Manager
Skills in this category: Project Management

## IT Quality Assurance
Relevant job titles: QA Manager
Skills in this category: Quality Assurance


SKILLS TAXONOMY INTERPRETATION GUIDANCE:
The skills taxonomy above provides standardized categorization of technical skills for this resume.
Use this taxonomy to guide your analysis of programming languages, software applications, and hardware.
When identifying skills, prefer terminology from the appropriate taxonomy categories, but don't hesitate to use different terms when they better represent the candidate's expertise.
Align your responses with the skill categories most relevant to this candidate's profile.
For software languages, applications, and hardware, use the taxonomy as a reference but feel empowered to include technologies that aren't listed if they are clearly important to the candidate's profile.
Example: If the taxonomy lists 'Java' but the resume shows extensive React.js experience, it's appropriate to list React.js even if it's not in the taxonomy.
Balance standardization with accuracy - prioritize capturing the candidate's true expertise over strict adherence to the taxonomy.
IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary technical category. These must be different from each other. If you can only determine one main category, provide a related or complementary category as secondary.

Use the following rules when assessing Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary Technical Languages: Include ALL types of technical languages mentioned in the resume, such as:- Database languages (SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL, MySQL, Oracle SQL, PostgreSQL)- Programming languages (Java, Python, C#, JavaScript, Ruby)- Scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, Shell, VBA)- Query languages (SPARQL, GraphQL, HiveQL)- Markup/stylesheet languages (HTML, CSS, XML)Prioritize languages based on:1. Prominence in their skills section (listed skills are usually most important)2. Frequency of mention throughout work history3. Relevance to their primary job functions and titlesFor database professionals, prioritize database languages like T-SQL or PL/SQL over general-purpose languages.

Use the following rules when assessing Most used Software Applications: Please only list out actual software applications. nothing else.Analyze their resume and determine what software they use most.If none can be found put NULL.

Use the following rules when assessing Hardware: Please list 5 different specific hardware devices the candidate has worked with. Hardware devices include many categories such as:
- Network equipment (firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers)
- Server hardware (blade servers, rack servers, chassis systems)
- Storage devices (SANs, NAS, RAID arrays, disk systems)
- Security appliances (TACALANEs, hardware encryption devices)
- Management interfaces (iDRAC, iLO, IMM, IPMI, BMC)
- Virtualization hardware (ESXi hosts, hyperconverged systems)
- Physical components (CPUs, RAM modules, hard drives, SSDs)
- Communication hardware (modems, wireless access points, VPN concentrators)
- Specialized hardware (tape libraries, KVM switches, console servers)

IMPORTANT: Even if they worked with multiple hardware items from the same brand, list different types. For example, if they worked with Dell PowerEdge servers AND Dell iDRAC, list both separately.

Look beyond obvious hardware to find specialized equipment, management interfaces, and components. Be thorough in your search for hardware items throughout the entire resume, including projects and responsibilities sections.

Be specific about hardware models and manufacturers when mentioned (e.g. 'Palo Alto PA-5200 series' rather than just 'firewalls'). Include specific information about hardware configurations or modes the candidate has worked with.

Please provide each hardware item on a separate line in this exact format:
Hardware 1: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 2: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 3: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 4: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 5: [Specific hardware device]

Try your best to identify 5 different hardware items. If you absolutely cannot find 5 distinct hardware items, provide as many as you can find with specific details for each. Only use NULL if no hardware at all is mentioned.

Based on this resume, give the user the information they need: 
# Charles Marshall
Phone: 281-630-1803 • Email: Charlesm.txland@gmail.com

## Education

Bachelors of Science in Agricultural Business Sam Houston State University, Huntsville, Texas

## Skills
* Sales Force CRM
* MS Office
* Sales Management
* Team Management
* Working Tradeshows
* Cold Calling	• Negotiation
* Microsoft Power Point • Database Programs
* Contract Drafting	• Map Right Land Mapping
* Sales Process	 • Lead Generation
* CRM Database
* Project Management
* Strategic Planning
* Marketing

## Experience

**for The Hillman Group Waco, TX** | Territory Manager for | Aug 2024

o Manage one of the largest Hillman Group territories in North America o Sold hardware and home improvement products, protective and job site gear including work gloves and job site storage, and Robotic kiosk technologies, including key duplication, engraving & knife sharpening to regional retail stores o Achieve sales goals and objectives along with developing new accounts through prospecting o Generate additional sales by selling new products and programs and Identify growth opportunities through expansions of existing customers o Maintain consistent call cycle with existing accounts o Develop a partnership that exemplifies trust and confidence in the Hillman program o Generate sales proposals, plan-o-grams, analytical analysis of business o Prepare special orders, pricing, and business agreements o Work with corporate staff to coordinate special projects and programs o Complete expense reporting requirements o Respond promptly to all customer issues and concerns o Provide a superior level of service to existing accounts
* Ranch Manager for M BAR Ranch Gatesville, TX
* February 2017 - April 2024

o Managed cattle herd to maintain a healthy, sustainable, profitable herd o Managed 1100 acres for a sustainable cattle herd, small hunting operation, and hay production o Guided and marketed hunts for the ranch utilizing a customer database o Maintained equipment o Maintained structures and improvements on the ranch o Managed contract labor for big construction projects on ranch o Implemented artificial insemination breeding program to produce a uniform calf crop o Improve land utilization with brush clearing and cedar management

**Ranch Real Estate Agent Ruple Properties & Texas Ranch Sales** | August 2016-February 2022
* Research land owners in the Hill Country, South Texas, Central Texas, Southwest Texas, and North Texas
* Utilize computer software to research land owners
* Cold Call land owners to prospect for new clients
* Negotiate land sales and terms of the sale for clients
* Lead a team of other agents helping them meet quarterly goals
* Help buyers find the ranch that best suites their vision and needs as well as help negotiate the sale
* Help sellers with marketing of their land as well as help negotiating the transaction
* Help sellers with the sale of nonreality property such as whitetail deer and exotic game along with helping new land owners acquire whitetail deer and or exotic game animals
* Photograph and market ranches in many regions of Texas
* Grow relationships with clients and future clients
* Bring buyers and sellers together and create a transaction that both parties are happy with
* Review contracts
* Review title work
* Help new land owners determine the best use of the land and helping them implement best use
* Sales Representative / Accounts Manager
* Petroleum Measurement Equipment Company Pearsall, Texas
* November 2014-August 2016
* Maintained business relations with Present and new customers in Eagle Ford Shale
* Acquired new business accounts in Eagle Ford Shale
* Negotiated prices for services i. e. Meter proving and LACT skid maintenance
* Delivered parts and equipment to customers
* Attended best measurement practices school put on by FMC Technologies
* Prospected Eagle Ford Shale Territory for new accounts
* Gained hands on experience of measurement equipment and services
* Gained experience in estimating construction, LACT, and skid fabrication projects • Attended Expos and training seminars to network and find future projects.

**/ Field Tech Champion Technologies Dilley, Texas** | Sales Representative / | February 2012 - November 2014
* Subcontracted to Anadarko Petroleum to assist in oil and gas production chemical needs in the Maverick Basin
* Maintained accurate chemical rates for production wells at appropriate parts per million levels
* Keep inventory for all chemical tanks
* Collected H2S readings
* Collected crude oil samples along with production water samples for analysis
* Perform full water titrate analysis on water samples
* Collected samples from production tank batteries for analysis
* Performed grind out tests on production tank and production oil samples
* Delivered chemical in emergency situations
* Represented Champion Technologies at chemical and well review meetings with Anadarko **Petroleum**
* Assisted with pipeline pigging jobs
* Completed H2S safety training
* Completed Safe Land training • Completed Smith Driving training **Internship**
* Agri Land Farm Credit Tyler, Texas May 2011-August 2011
* Analyzed customers credit and collateral
* Analyzed customers creditworthiness
* Took intro to farm credit training at Farm Credit Bank of Texas
* Reviewed credit actions
* Inspected customers assets
* Created credit actions for potential customers
* Gained experience in customer relations
